text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at how @data.characters.f1_mother.name manages to take care of herself when life gets a bit too much.

text_2.eng:
@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Mother, come and play with me with my dolls!” 

 @data.characters.f1_mother.name  *(thinking)*: “I am feeling so stressed. Let me take a deep breath... Phewww… Maybe I can finish cooking and then take a few minutes to play with @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. It will take my mind off all these worries.”

character_1_text.eng: Mother, come and play with me with my dolls!

character_2_text.eng: (thinking) I am feeling so stressed. Let me take a deep breath... Phewww… Maybe I can finish cooking and then take a few minutes to play with @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. It will take my mind off all these worries.

 @data.characters.f1_mother.name  *(thinking)*: “I am feeling so stressed. Let me take a deep breath... Phewww… Maybe I can finish cooking and then take a few minutes to play with @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. It will take my mind off all these worries.”
rows.character_1_text: Mother, come and play with me with my dolls!
rows.character_2_text: (thinking) I am feeling so stressed. Let me take a deep breath... Phewww… Maybe I can finish cooking and then take a few minutes to play with @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. It will take my mind off all these worries.

text_2.eng:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name: “Alright, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name, let me finish dinner quickly, and then I will come play with you.” 

 @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Okay, Mother.”

character_1_text.eng: Alright, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name, let me finish dinner quickly, and then I will come play with you.

rows.text_2:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name: “Alright, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name, let me finish dinner quickly, and then I will come play with you.” 

 @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Okay, Mother.”
rows.character_1_text: Alright, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name, let me finish dinner quickly, and then I will come play with you.

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f1_mother.name  *(thinking)*: “I am glad I took some time with my child. I feel a bit better and my mind feels clearer already. After dinner, I deserve a cup of tea by myself.”

character_1_text.eng: (thinking) I am glad I took some time with my child. I feel a bit better and my mind feels clearer already. After dinner, I deserve a cup of tea by myself.

rows.text_2: @data.characters.f1_mother.name  *(thinking)*: “I am glad I took some time with my child. I feel a bit better and my mind feels clearer already. After dinner, I deserve a cup of tea by myself.”
rows.character_1_text: (thinking) I am glad I took some time with my child. I feel a bit better and my mind feels clearer already. After dinner, I deserve a cup of tea by myself.

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f1_mother.name  *(thinking)*: “What a day. I have a lot on my plate, but I am still standing and trying my best every day. Tomorrow, I should visit with my friends so we can catch up and be reminded that we aren't alone!"

character_1_text.eng: (thinking) What a day. I have a lot on my plate, but I am still standing and trying my best every day. Tomorrow, I should visit with my friends so we can catch up and be reminded that we aren't alone!

rows.text_2: @data.characters.f1_mother.name  *(thinking)*: “What a day. I have a lot on my plate, but I am still standing and trying my best every day. Tomorrow, I should visit with my friends so we can catch up and be reminded that we aren't alone!"
rows.character_1_text: (thinking) What a day. I have a lot on my plate, but I am still standing and trying my best every day. Tomorrow, I should visit with my friends so we can catch up and be reminded that we aren't alone!

text_1_facilitator.eng: @data.characters.f1_mother.name did a few things that can also help us when we are feeling overwhelmed.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Have another look at @data.characters.f1_mother.name’s facial expression and thoughts. She is feeling stressed and worried.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, @data.characters.f1_mother.name feels stressed and worried about everything happening in her life.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, @data.characters.f1_mother.name feels stressed and worried about everything happening in her life.

quiz_2_question.eng: What does @data.characters.f1_mother.name do to manage her stress?

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Yes, taking a pause helps in stressful moments. Even taking a few deep breaths can help us feel better and respond more calmly. She also praised herself, rewarded herself with a quiet cup of tea, and made a plan to spend time with a friend.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Exactly. Play helped @data.characters.f1_mother.name to connect with @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name and forget about her worries for a moment.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: That’s right! @data.characters.f1_mother.name recognises she is trying her best in difficult circumstances. She also took a pause, rewarded herself with a quiet cup of tea, and made a plan to spend time with a friend.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Exactly, @data.characters.f1_mother.name creates a moment in the evening to enjoy a cup of tea by herself. Having this moment also helps her to come up with other ways to get support.  She also took a pause, praised herself, played with her daughter, and made a plan to spend time with a friend.

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng: Yes, when we isolate ourselves, problems will start to feel even bigger. Reaching out to a friend can help. She also took a pause, praised herself, played with her daughter, and rewarded herself with a quiet cup of tea.

quiz_3_question.eng: How is @data.characters.f1_mother.name feeling when she does something small for herself?

quiz_3_feedback_1.eng: Exactly! She is able to feel calmer for a moment and think more positively.

quiz_3_feedback_2.eng: She may still have the same worries, but she also recognises she is trying her best and others are there to support her.

quiz_3_feedback_3.eng: Have another look at what @data.characters.f1_mother.name does. After taking care of herself, she feels more positive and hopeful.
